gurmukhi: rupy Kwin KUnI krY lwg ju`DM ] muKM rkq nYxM Bry sUr kRuDM ]45]
transliteration: Roupe Khaan(i) Khoonoo Darai Laag Juddhan|| Moukhanndrakat Nainan Bhare Soor Krudhan||45||
translation: The bloody Khans stood firmly and began to fight with faces and eyes red with ire.45.

gurmukhi: jigXo jMg jwlm su joDM juJwrM ] bhy bwx bwNky brCI duDwrM ]
transliteration: Jagiyo Jan Jaalam Su Jodhan Jujhaaran|| Bade Baan Baanke Barchhodh Dudhaaran||
translation: The terrible battle of valiant warriors began. The arrows, spears and double-edged swords were used by the heroes.

gurmukhi: imly bIr bIrM mhwN DIr bMky ] Dkw Dik sYQM kiRpwnM JnMky ]46]
transliteration: Mile Boor Booran Mahaan Dhoor Banke|| Dhakaa Dhak(i) Saithan Kridaanan Jhananke||46||
translation: The warriors met being pushed forward and the swords are jingling.46.

gurmukhi: Bey Fol FMkwr nwdM nPIrM ] auTY bwhu AwGwq g`jY su bIrM ]
transliteration: Bhae Dhol Dhankaar Naadan Naphooran|| Outhai Baah(u) Aaghaat Gadjai Su Booran||
translation: The drums and the fifes are resounding, the arms rise to strike blows and the brave fighters are roaring.

gurmukhi: nvM n`d nIswn b`jy ApwrM ] ruly q`C mu`CM auTI ssqR JwrM ]47]
transliteration: Navan Nadd Noosaan Bajje Apaaran|| Rule Tachchh Mouchchhan Outhoo Sastra Jhaaran||47||
translation: The new trumpets resound in great numbers. The chopped heroes are rolling in dust and the sparks arise with the collision of weapons.47.

gurmukhi: tkw tu`k topM Fkw Fu`k FwlM ] mhwN bIr bwnYq bMky ibkRwlM ]
transliteration: Takaa Toukk Topan Dhakaa Dhoukk Dhaalan|| Mahaan Boor Baanait Banke Bikraalan||
translation: The helmets and shield have been broken into bits and the great heroes shooting arrows look terrible and not elegant.

gurmukhi: ncy bIr bYqwlXM BUq pRyqM ] ncI fwikxI jogxI aurD hyqM ]48]
transliteration: Nache Boor Baitaalayan Bhoot Pretan|| Nachoo Daakinoo Jogadoo Urdh Hetan||48||
translation: The heroic sprits, ghosts, fiends and goblins are dancing. The vampires, female demons and Shiva also are dancing.48.

gurmukhi: CutI jog qwrI mhwN rudR jwgy ] figXo iDAwn bHmM sBY is`D Bwgy ]
transliteration: Chhoutoo Jog Tdaroo Mahaan Rudra Jaage|| Dagiyo Dhiaan Brahman Sabhai Siddh Bhaage||
translation: The Supreme Rudra hath awakened on coming out of the Yogic contemplation. The meditation of Brahma hath been interrupted and all the Siddhas (adepts) in great fear have run away from their abodes.

gurmukhi: hsy ikMnrM j`C ib`idAw DryXM ] ncI A`Crw p`Crw cwrxyXM ]49]
transliteration: Hase Kinnaran Jachchh Biddiaa Ddareyan|| Nachoo Achchhraa Pachchhraa Chaarneyan|| Nachoo Achchhraa Pachchhraa Chaarneyan||49||
translation: The Kinnaers, Yakshas and Vidyadhars are laughing and the wives of bards are dancing.49.

gurmukhi: pirE Gor ju`DM su sYnw prwnI ] qhwN KwN husYnI mMifE bIr bwnI ]
transliteration: Pario Ghor Juddhan Su Sainaa Paraanoo|| Tahaan Khaan Housainoo Mandio Boor Baanoo||
translation: The fight was most terrible and the army fled away. The great hero Hussain stood firmly in the fled away. The great hero Hussain stood firmly in the field.

gurmukhi: auqY bIr Dwey su bIrM jsÍwrM ] sbY ibauq fwry bgw sy AsÍwrM ]50]
transliteration: Outai Boor Dhaae Su Booran Jasvaaran|| Sabai Biout Ddare Juddh Khanbhan Ranan Bhoom Gaddan||50||
translation: The heroes of Jaswal ran towards him. The horsemen were cut in the manner the cloth is cut (by the tailor).50.

gurmukhi: qhwN KwN husYnI rihE eyk TwFM ] mno ju`D KMBM rxM BUm gwfM ]
transliteration: Tahaan Khaan Housainirahio Ek Thaadhan|| Mano Juddh Khanbhan||
translation: There Hussain stood quite alone like the pole of a flagg fixed in the ground.

gurmukhi: ijsY kop kY kY hTI bwx mwirE ] iqsY Cyd kY pYl pwry pDwirE ]51]
transliteration: Jisai Kop Kai Kai Hathoo Baan Maario|| Tisai Chhed Kai Pail Pdare Padhaario||51||
translation: Wherever that tenacious warrior shot his arrow, it pierced though the body and went out. 51.

gurmukhi: shy bwx sUrM sBY Awx FUkY ] chUM Er qy mwr hI mwr kUkY ]
transliteration: Sahe Baan Sooran Sabhai Aan Dhookai|| Chahoon Or Te Maar Hoo Maar Kookai||
translation: The warriors who were struck by arrows came together against him. From all the four sides, they shouted “kill, kill”.
